016package de.cuioss.test.jsf.renderer.util;
017
018import de.cuioss.tools.io.IOStreams;
019import lombok.experimental.UtilityClass;
020import org.jdom2.Attribute;
021import org.jdom2.Document;
022import org.jdom2.Element;
023import org.jdom2.JDOMException;
024import org.jdom2.input.SAXBuilder;
025
026import javax.xml.XMLConstants;
027import java.io.IOException;
028import java.util.ArrayList;
029import java.util.List;
030
031import static de.cuioss.tools.string.MoreStrings.emptyToNull;
032import static java.util.Objects.requireNonNull;
033
034/**
035 * Helper class providing convenience methods for dealing with Dom trees.
036 *
037 * @author Oliver Wolff
038 */
039@UtilityClass
040public class DomUtils {
041
042    /**
043     * The root element for creating {@link Document}s. This ensures correct
044     * structure regarding xml only having one root-element
045     */
046    public static final String ROOT_TEMPLATE = "<root>%s</root>";
047
048    /**
049     * Creates an instance of {@link Document} for the given htmlString. It always
050     * uses {@link #ROOT_TEMPLATE} as the root element.
051     *
052     * @param htmlString must not be null
053     * @return the created {@link Document} with {@link #ROOT_TEMPLATE} as the root
054     * element.
055     */
056    public static Document htmlStringToDocument(final String htmlString) {
057        requireNonNull(htmlString);
058        final var wrappedInput = ROOT_TEMPLATE.formatted(htmlString);
059        try (var input = IOStreams.toInputStream(wrappedInput)) {
060            var saxBuilder = new SAXBuilder();
061            saxBuilder.setProperty(XMLConstants.ACCESS_EXTERNAL_DTD, "");
062            saxBuilder.setProperty(XMLConstants.ACCESS_EXTERNAL_SCHEMA, "");
063            return saxBuilder.build(input);
064        } catch (JDOMException | IOException e) {
065            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Unable to parse given String, due to ", e);
066        }
067    }
068
069    /**
070     * Extracts all attributes with the given name. The method will recursively
071     * check all children as well.
072     *
073     * @param element       to be checked, must not be null.
074     * @param attributeName to be looked for, must not be null nor empty.
075     * @return a {@link List} with the found attributes, never null but may be
076     * empty.
077     */
078    public static List<Attribute> filterForAttribute(final Element element, final String attributeName) {
079        requireNonNull(element);
080        requireNonNull(emptyToNull(attributeName));
081        List<Attribute> found = new ArrayList<>();
082        var current = element.getAttribute(attributeName);
083        if (null != current) {
084            found.add(current);
085        }
086        for (Element child : element.getChildren()) {
087            found.addAll(filterForAttribute(child, attributeName));
088        }
089        return found;
090    }
091
092    /**
093     * Extracts all attributes with the given name and the attribute-value
094     * containing the given String. The method will recursively check all children
095     * as well.
096     *
097     * @param element            to be checked, must not be null.
098     * @param attributeName      to be looked for, must not be null nor empty.
099     * @param attributeValuePart the string of the attribute value to be filtered
100     *                           for.
101     * @return a {@link List} with the found attributes, never null but may be
102     * empty.
103     */
104    public static List<Attribute> filterForAttributeContainingValue(final Element element, final String attributeName,
105                                                                    final String attributeValuePart) {
106        requireNonNull(emptyToNull(attributeValuePart));
107
108        return filterForAttribute(element, attributeName).stream()
109            .filter(a -> a.getValue().contains(attributeValuePart)).toList();
110    }
111}
